The wait was a little long, but not unreasonable.

Overall, a really nice spot to pop in and grab a drink to go whilst meandering GGP or escape a cool gray day and warm up with something tasty!
author: Alex F.

description:
I stopped in here yesterday on the way to the De Young for a quick cup of tea.
I know they are still in 'just opened' mode but ordering was a little chaotic - there was a woman behind the counter who did not acknowledge I was there, and then another woman came up and was about to take my order but she got distracted by someone, so a third woman took my order.
Their menu says they serve loose leaf tea but actually it is Mighty Leaf - in a tea bag.
Had I known that was what they served I honestly would have gotten something different, because I don't like Mighty Leaf.
They don't have as many tables and chairs as Cafe Muse did, and the space didn't feel quite finished.
I hope they do really well, and I will definitely give them a second chance again soon.
author: Rachel M.

description: Incredibly disappointed with their customer service. We came in for 2 coffees and a chia seed pudding.  They forgot 1 of the drinks and when we asked for it, they still took a bit of time making it and putting other drinks out in the meantime.  The iced coffee came in a hot cup, when I asked for an iced cup with a lid, because we were on the go they, said sorry we can't.  They would simply not give me an iced cup, even after purchasing two drinks, food and waiting for a long time after they forgot about it in the first place.  The drinks were great, chia seed pudding decent, but the customer service is terrible.
author: Stephanie U.

description: This place is LITERALLY unbelievable and has the best coffee EVER and much better than the phoney Siteglass or overpriced starfucks! I love this place and I go here every single dingle day.
author: John M.

description: Say and worked for a few hours in the morning.  Plenty of plugs, good coffee and a Belgium waffle.  Smiles behind the counter were a plus!  I'll be back.
author: Nick M.

description:
This new coffeeshop is quite the jewel of the Richmond district. The moment I walked in the owners and workers greeted and welcomed me, which is quite important as first impressions really set the tone of a cafe experience. 

They serve Mr. Espresso coffee beans, which I heard is roasted with oakwood. Clearly they know how to utilize and sell a quality product because their lattes are each individually, uniquely, skillfully, and deliciously-made. Co-owner and barista, Vashelle knows how to make a mean cup o joe! 

The other guys who own and work there are really friendly people too. Brian and Vananson both always seem down to have a chat and get to know their customers. You can really tell that they are passionate about not only what they sell, but also the surrounding community; fundamental in order for them to learn how to better serve the neighborhood.

If you're in the area, don't hesitate to stop by, say hello, grab a bite to eat (they serve waffles, WAFFLES!!!!) and have your coffee and your day made.

P.s. They have an awesome picture of the justice league members hanging out on the wall. Superheroes ftw!
author: James W.

description: Love this fantastic neighborhood spot.  Espresso is bold, service is super friendly, and options unique and delicious!  So glad they opened!
author: Megan D.

description: Amazing!! I had the Iced Whopper Latte and donut muffin! It was heaven!! Definitely would recommend. And it wasn't crowded at all on a Saturday morning which is a HUGE plus!!
author: Krystyna P.

description: Great coffee, friendly staff, clean. I might have a new favorite local coffee joint! Thanks!
author: David H.

description:
Rise & Grind is without a doubt the best coffee/tea shop in the Richmond District quite possibly in San Francisco. Everything on the menu from the food to the drinks is delicious, but it's all also uniquely one of a kind. I live down the street from Rise & Grind and couldn't have been more pleased to have a local coffee spot with great food and even nicer employees open when they did a few months ago. They have a variety of specialty drinks like the creme brulee latte, cookie butter latte and their newly added Richmond chill, which is their version of Vietnamese coffee with espresso and condensed milk shaken up in a cocktail mixer. If you're not a big coffee drinker I highly recommend the London fog.

I've tried almost all of the food items and have to put the Avocado Toast at the top of the list; a delicious thick piece of toast topped with a nice hearty spread of fresh avocado, red chili flakes, and a soft boiled egg. It will surely leave you full for hours. The breakfast biscuit is another one of my favorites as well as the Pesto Toast (AMAZING), but their variety of waffles if especially delicious and one of a kind. My favorite is the Matcha waffle. Try it, you're taste buds will thank me.

Along with all the great menu items, the environment and staff are something that makes Rise & Grind especially enjoyable for me. The owners have gone out of their way to put local artists work on the walls and the business has a number of regulars you'll often see every time you go in. There's a great communal and hospitable vibe that keeps me coming back for more. To add to all the greatness of Rise & Grind, there is Cori the corgi, the resident dog who sets up camp at the spot every day and greets customers with a big smile. He's always willing to be played with and adds to the greatness of the baristas. If I could, I'd give Rise & Grind 10 stars but Yelp only lets me give 5. This is a must try coffee spot if you're in the neighborhood or go through this part of town.
author: Niko L.

description: This spot is another one of my favorite coffee shops in SF. The employees are all so welcoming and all the coffees (drip, mocha, latte, etc.) are so delicious. In addition to the coffee, this spot has a breakfast menu that has really delicious toasts, sandwiches, and waffles. And if you get lucky, you might meet Cory the corgi who just brightens up your day with his cuteness.
author: Tina A.

description: Cute little place good for some casual reading time but the drinks and food items were a bit underwhelming. My black sesame latte lacked flavor, the coffee was a bit sour, the matcha waffle didn't impress my son at all. The avocado toast was okay. Too bad. I am always on the hunt for good local options but this one definitely did not stand up to the 4.5 stars on yelp.
author: S L.

description:
Great little coffee place with friendly staff

Got the following:

Cold brew: 5 stars, pure coffee taste without any sourness or bitterness

Spicy chai tea latte: 5 stars, love the extra punch of flavor from the ginger

Will be back!
author: Hazel J.

description:
I'm writing this in the full knowledge that they are only newly open and still finding their way. But while i understand they may be new to the coffee business they give the distinct impression that they have never even been to a coffee shop as a customer either.
For example, they have only one size of coffee cup for take out. (Small) At $2:75 a pop this is pretty steep.
They have a choice of only white or brown sugar, no sweetener nor sugar supplement, like so many others i am diabetic and i take Splenda in my coffee, raw sugar is a health hazard for me.
I am really happy to see a new business open. The staff seem very friendly and capable and i wish them all the best in the future, just hope they can make these small changes soon.
author: Paula M.

description: Loved this cafe in the Richmond. I got a London Fog hot tea which was AMAZING and the avocado toast which was also mind blowing. Positives: drink was great and sweet, toast was on really soft brioche like bread (nice and thick), avocado was super fresh, egg was just the right amount of soft. Negatives: the tea comes in a tiny cup so you are paying like $4 for an x-small drink (done in 3 sips) and they don't have a "large" option only 1 size. Toast is $9. My entire order ended up being $17 with tip and tax which seems steep for a coffee shop. But wifi is good and nice baristas.
author: Brenda I.

description: To say I've been here a few times is an understatement. The staff is always warm and welcoming. The black sesame latte and the cookie butter latte are my favorites. The corn toast is my favorite food item and my friends love the avocado toast. Great spot to study, do a little work, catch up with friends, and people watch. Check them out!
author: Brendon L.

description: Finally, a legit coffee place in the Richmond district! I got a regular cappucino and my girlfriend got the creme brulee latte. The cappucino was smooth, nicely pulled, and she wrote my name on the latte art :). The creme brulee latte is a sweet latte with a hard sugary coating on top, like creme brulee. The barista actually used a blowtorch to caramelize the sugar after she poured the milk. Will definitely be back again to sample their other drinks and pastries.
author: Eric W.

description:
Good spot for decent coffee and a quiet hang out just feet from the greenery of golden gate park.  Friendly, interested owner operators.  Light, airy room with various small seating areas and wifi.  

Coffee by Mr Espresso, an older Oakland roasters using oak wood to roast; not your usual grassy, bold new-SF roast. I'm used to the newer blend so found this well-rounded and definitely satisfying, but nothing adventurous or unexpected.  This is the style the operators said he is after so kudos to him; many will enjoy it fully. 

Had banana walnut cake.. a bit expected and wouldn't repeat. 

Overall a solid 4 spot.  Would definitely come here again, an oasis is an area of not much going on, handy to the lovely park. Good stop on your way to or from  the bridge.
author: dean b.

description:
Went to this spot 2 days in a row in my 3 day stay in San Francisco. It was close by to our air bnb and seemed cool. The first day my friend got iced mocha and I had a soy chai latte .. both were good. The next day was as if it was a totally different place. My friend got a vanilla latte this time and I got the same soy ice chai latte ... the soy chai latte tasted like a Luke warm cup of soy milk. The latte was okay, but not worthy of a repeat purchase. 

We also had the Belgian waffle which was dry and barely had anything on it  .. they had no syrup. When I asked for syrup the girl said " we don't have it.. that's why we put the icing on it".  Which would be fine! If there was enough of it. 

But, my biggest issue with this place was their effort to be hip and cool ... being met with not a single vegetarian / vegan or progressive food option ... there is pepperoni on one of the menu items and this to me is just careless. They serve their iced dine in drinks in mason jars ( all the rage) but their avocado toast has hard boiled eggs on it ( a usual safe vegan option) 

Overall this place doesn't seem consistent. To go two days in a row and have a completely different experience the second day is concerning. Also, get some vegan options... this is San Francisco and it's 2017.
author: Vee R.

description: This coffee shop is a breath of fresh air in the Inner Richmond. They have an avocado toast to die for, as well as creative lattes and tasty cookies. The owners are super friendly and really make an effort to get to know you. This has become a regular go-to spot for me and a place I take my friends whenever they visit from out of town.
author: Michael H.

description: I ordered a creme brûlée latte and it was not as good as the one that I had during my previous visit, but the owner heard my comment and offered a bacon beer muffin and a strawberry muffin to make up for it. There is no question that the customer service here is amazing. Highly recommend.
author: Queenie R.

description: Great atmosphere, phenomenal iced coffee, and friendly staff.
author: Emily B.

description: Get the creme brulee latte!! I got it with soy milk but it is really good. They use the blow torch to burn the top of the drink. It reminds me of the creme brulee at LA Mill.  Cute location right by Golden Gate park and Fulton Street in the Richmond district. Cute tables and chairs. Parking may be a bit hard as there is nothing much (other stores, etc) in the area so its all residential but you may be able to find a spot along the park on Fulton Street. I had to park a few blocks away near Safeway. I am looking forward to going back and trying other specialty drinks.
author: Cicely T.

description: Such a great find! Rise and Grind is friendly, inviting, warm and oh so close to the park. I was greeted with cute decor and all smiles from the baristas when I journeyed in this AM to avoid the typical Saturday brunch chaos. I tried the creme brûlée latte in a cappuccino size and I was very pleasantly surprised by the unique texture on the top. The espresso was extracted very nicely, it was evident throughout the drink. It was followed with a perfectly poached egg on the avo toast- and pizzaz of red pepper flakes. I was reluctant to even leave for my walk in the park. I can't wait to try the rest of the menu! Get there quick before the rest of the world find it!
author: Abbie G.

description: They opened just two weeks ago. On this rainy/ gloomy day, I wanted to have a cup of latte to make my day complete. I stopped by this place since I live in the area.  Very cute, cozy inside. The staffs were so chill and friendly. I'm definitely coming back for studying.
author: Mona E.

description: Cute coffee shop, very cozy, yet spacious and inviting. The owners are very personable and downright adorable! I recommend trying their creme brûlée latte!yummy
author: Nerrissa M.

description: They made a shiba in my latte! That's some skills right there. I've never had anyone make anything cool in my drinks. Definitely coming back to see what else they can do. Maybe they can make my face on my drink next time
author: David T.

description:
This new coffee house is awesome. My wife and I came here and got an Organic Seven Bridges pour over, a cold brew, and the avocado toast. 

The coffee was excellent. Balanced, flavorful, and not sour or bitter. The cold brew was equally as good. 

The avocado toast really stole the show though. It came out on 1-inch thick pieces of toasted white bread with an avocado spread that reminded me of deviled eggs (I think they whip the avocado with mayo and some light mustard seed) and a perfectly cooked soft-boiled egg. 

This place also gets top marks for customer service! They were super friendly with our pooch, giving her treats and they were friendly and engaging during and after the transaction. 

Overall, we love our new neighborhood coffee shop. We will absolutely be coming here regularly.
author: Connor O.

description: I was drawn into this place by the cute honey bear sign out front.  It's located in a quiet area of the Richmond across the street from Golden Gate park.  The inside is bright and happy with local art featured on the walls, the staff is friendly and the coffee is great! I'm so happy I found this little gem because the Richmond is lacking in great coffee shops.  Definitely recommend coming here and am looking forward to going back.
author: Shelby N.

description: This is a cute little coffee shop right outside of Golden Gate Park. My friends and I came in here because we had some time to kill before dinner and thought we could use a cup of coffee. As we stepped in we noticed the clean eclectic look, and the walls dotted with art for sale- assuming these are local artists. Anywho there were two people behind the counter and both were equally friendly. They helped us order and they talked to me about a lot of local sushi spots since they overheard that's what we were having for dinner. The two were very pleasant and helpful. We al ordered coffee from the specials menu, including a creme brûlée latte, salted caramel late, and a whopper latte. All the drinks were delicious and served adorably. Glad we came in, definitely worth it.
author: Anum A.

description:
Absolutely love Rise & Grind! I've been on the hunt for the perfect cafe to study: somewhere not too loud, a chill environment, and most importantly great coffee. 
Rise & Grind has gone beyond my standards! It's a great place to study as, on a weekday, it doesn't get overwhelmingly loud and busy. They also keep their music at a lower volume, so it's a nice place to read. The environment is always clean and there's a good amount of tables to sit and chat or like me, set up your laptop to study. 
I have yet to order any of the food or fancy lattes, however, I do get the cold brew and it's very good and strong!
If you are a huge dog lover like me, the owners bring in their pet Corgi named Cori who is adorably friendly and minds his business. Also, the staff is incredibly personable. I've noticed that they greet every customer that comes in and asks how everything tasted before you head out, a rare experience for a coffee shop in the city! Highly recommend whether you're looking for a drink to-go, to get work done, or for a conversation over some good coffee with a friend
author: Tricia Angela L.

description: Peanut butter latte & the Belgian waffle are to die for!! I liked that the cafe is spacious and doesn't feel like everyone is on top of each other. Great atmosphere and service, and love the corgi puppy :)
author: Lindsey B.

description: I heard they had peanut butter lattes... so I had to stop by and try one. I was more than pleased with the latte and thoroughly enjoyed talking to the two baristas (owners I assume).  They were very knowledgable about coffee and the roasting procedures and shared some fun history of their coffee (Mr. Espresso) roaster. They also have Devil's teeth biscuits, which is really nice for us who live a tad too far in the richmond to make it there on a regular basis. I love this place I can't wait to negate future work outs here.
author: Katie P.

description: This place used to be known as something else and OMG it was terrible before! Now that it's changed to Rise&Grind, it's MUCH BETTER! The workers are always extremely friendly and, as someone who is very indecisive, they never put pressure on me to hurry. The place looks kind of hipster, but it definitely feels like the old SF (friendly, unique, dog-friendly, and makes everyone feel welcome). The waffles seemed to be a MUST-TRY because every time I go in I see people eating them. I decided to try one of their waffles and it definitely is pretty tasty. My only complaint is their coffee sucks (ironic, isn't it?). Yes, their coffee is terrible. A $4 cup of cappuccino was extremely small and tasted like bitter water. I've also tasted their cold brew and that tasted exactly the same (like bitter water). The coffee is definitely not good, but I leave them a tip anyway because the service is that good. So, if you can, come and chill and order some food...but you may want to hit up some other place for a coffee. Or do what I do, go back home and make Viet coffee.
author: Cathy V.

description: Really nice service. Great quality products and awesome sandwich and snack options. Wish more coffee places could be like this one.
author: Arik H.

description: Awesome coffee and cute corgi to pet. Very nice owner. Will be back.
author: Ben G.

description: This is a small but notable cafe on the edge of Golden Gate Park in a residential block. It was popular and the coffee was good. The barista cared about pouring a good cup. Lovely spot to start the day.
author: Liz R.

description: I was staying at my sister's around the corner and found this place on Yelp. What a find. I had the breakfast sandwich. Delicious!  The flavors going on in this tasty bun were unlike anything I've tasted on any breakfast sandwich. And the bun they put it in was warm, crusty, and a perfect choice for the tasty ingredients inside. Can't wait to come back. Oh, and coffee was great too!
author: Anne T.

description: I recently visited for some breakfast. The coffee was OK but small and bitter, I had an Ube waffle order... it wasn't very good, and really pricey. But the thing that was really annoying was, while surveying the menu, the lady behind the counter kept looking me and my girlfriend up and down in a judge-y way. I'm not sure why... I made sure nobody else was in line waiting while we looked at the menu, just to be sure we weren't holding up a line. I won;t be going back.
author: Ara A.

description: Great neighborhood spot to grab well-done coffee and some good food. Has internet, so many people are there working on laptops.
author: Kayla G.

description: This plc has become a regular weekly coffee spot for me and I don't even live in the Richmond. They have super creative drinks like the whopper latte that's delicious and it isn't made too sweet. I also like their take on avocado toast.
author: Kristy M.

description: Friendliest owners and baristas around! Haven't had a snack or a drink that I didn't like. The quality of the coffee and ingredients are all exceptional. This has become my go-to cafe: wifi, easy-to-find parking, right across from GG Park... what more can you ask for?
author: Shannon B.

description: I love this place. The coffee is delicious and unique. Especially the whopper latte! The staff are very nice, a couple times coming in and they'll know your name. The place is very cozy and the perfect spot to study. Also, if you're a dog lover so many dogs come in. Rise and grind is definitely a place to try.
author: Scarlett M.

description: I live in the neighborhood and hadn't realized this place changed ownership. The interior had a remake--an attempt at industrial chic--but came across cold and unfinished-looking. I ordered a breakfast sandwich and it took 30 minutes to make it. They told me it took so long because they forgot the egg. [There are only three ingredients in this--egg a pretty central part of the sandwich]. Would not go back.
author: Michelle B.

description: I work in the park this is the best coffee greatest eats. What they call it " sweet and savory ", I love the staff and the atmosphere. PS I love Cory The Corgi
author: sid s.

description: Really love this place. They make delicious lattes and avocado toasts and they a cute corgi puppy. So adorable.
author: Vivienne W.

description: I was hoping to add this place to my routine, since it's on my morning route and often has a parking spot out front. But when I stopped in, I was underwhelmed. They don't have the things I need in the morning. Only one size of house coffee--not big enough!  Their menu is full of twee coffee drinks and precious little things to eat but everything has to be made for you and the basics are missing.  No bagels to grab, no coffee self-service.  Also, the staff was neutral and matter-of-fact rather than friendly or accommodating. If you want to pay too much to be waited on in the morning, rather than a quick toasted bagel and a hearty house coffee, it's clean and accessible at least. PS the coffee is really bitter.
author: Lorelei S.

description: The biscoff latte is really good!  I also really like their breakfast sandwiches and strawberry muffins.  They know how to treat their customers.  A few times our food was delayed to come out and they will apologize and give us a free muffin.  Top notch.  My only gripe is the location and parking.  Great if you live nearby but if not then you may need to drive around a few times until you find a spot.  Dont let that stop you tho, this place should not be skipped.
author: Tony Q.

description: While it may be overpriced, their coffee and food will not disappoint. It's my first time here and I got the biscuit cookie butter latte and the breakfast biscuit sandwich. The latte was just right, it wasn't too sweet. And the biscuit was really good too with really fresh avocado.
author: Alejandra B.

description: This is our go to cafe, just a few feet from my house with the kindest service! The owners, V & V are fantastic and the food is awesome!
author: Breee R.

description: SF is full of great coffee shops and this one is no exception. It's a great place to study/work and get a really delicious drink. I've only had the americano and the mint cold brew so far but I'll definitely be back! Super yummy toasts and their pastries looked great. Extremely friendly staff. You won't regret coming here!
author: Kylee P.

description: Amazing coffee and a great spot to grab a breakfast bite!!!! Super friendly owners too!!!!
author: Aron L.

description: The most amazing coffee shop in the city.. and dog friendly. Great coffee, incredible food (get the avocado toast) and the service is out of this world. So happy to have this place in our neighborhood!
author: Maggie H.

description: Have to add to the other 5 star reviews here. Rise & Grind is definitely the perfect neighborhood coffee spot to catch up with friends or get some work done and has become an instant hit; it's also a great place for people enjoying a day in the park to stop and grab a cup of something delicious. The coffee is strong and the latte flavors are inventive and irresistible (try the biscoff flavor for sure!). The food menu is limited but tasty (especially the breakfast sandwich, which, sadly for the waistline, is both insanely good and very addictive). High praise to the wonderful ownership, especially Vi. He and all the baristas, know every single customer by name and make them feel welcomed and at home as soon as they set foot through the door. Love this place!
author: Nina S.

description: this place is great. you can pop out of the park for a quick coffee and waffle. the staff are super friendly and it's nice and cool.inside out of the sun.
author: Alla B.

description: Amazing neighborhood coffee shop. Calm atmosphere and unique/tasty menu. If you haven't been yet you gotta get out there.
author: Lydia B.

description: Disorganized, undercooked food. Lots of things on the menu that they don't actually have. Run by inexperienced kids from the look of it.
author: SF R.

description:
This place is near where I work.  I come here about once a week.  The folks seem friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed and open.  They have some graphics and art on display, and I believe they're open to local artists contributing their pieces for ambiance and possibly sale.  

I haven't had a chance to sit and try some of their food items so I can't give a full review, but this is a solid place to grab a hot beverage and maybe chit chat with folks.
author: V. Y.

description: Adorable little coffee shop with ample seating and the most friendly owners! Plus they are always playing country music or NSYNC. So basically I love coming in. I tend to stick the the usual cappuccino or latte but I'll have to try some of the specialty drinks after reading other reviews!
author: Amanda D.

description: The creme brûlée latte was amazing and the pesto toast was also really great. Right next to golden gate park so that's also a plus. The staff was extremely nice and it's a great place to get some work done.
author: Vicky M.

description:
Stopped in here one day after just noticing that they opened (two weeks prior), 
had one of the best lattes.  I was truly impressed, came back again the next week and was able to sit inside this time, I loved the atmosphere, the wonderfully friendly people that work there (owners) and their beverages!
author: John M H.

description: I was looking for a place to grab a quick bite with my kids after a visit from the Academy of Sciences. I ordered the avocado toast with no peppers and the waffle. After what seemed like a long wait, the toast came with peppers. I didn't feel like waiting another 10 mins to have them fix it. I ended up eating the toast as my kids didn't like pepper so they ate the waffle. Overall, I would probably not order the food again. I did get the drip coffee and it was good and strong.
author: Jen T.

description: Great place to study! I've tried the London Fog, maple scone and creme brûlée latte. All excellent accompanied with friendly service.
author: Breanna T.

description: Great to see new coffee & tea shop in Inner Richmond.  Opened 2 days, still setting up & excited to be offering waffles in couple days.
author: Richard B.

description: I stumbled across this spot on my way back form after leaving another coffee shop due to poor internet connection...the spot is quaint and quirky...Dr. Suess left a quote on the floor as you walk in, local artists are welcomed to decorate their walls with their work, the bathroom is clean and smells good, AND the coffee is DELICIOUS. Aside from its charm and tasty Mr. Expresso coffee, the staff are warm, friendly, and welcoming. So lucky to have this spot in my neighborhood!
author: Jessie H.

description: I love to study and do homework at coffee shops but it was always a pain having to walk so far from my apartment to reach a coffee shop and most of the time it's crowded with people which is really annoying. My sister recommended this place to me since it's close to my apartment. I love how the place is super spacious and tastefully decorated! It gives off a simple and cozy vibe. I ordered an iced vanilla latte and it was served to me in a cute mason jar. I think this place is perfect for students like me to study and drink delicious coffee while at it! Will definitely be going back
author: Anelise T.

description: Ordered a latte and was rewarded with two cute cream kitties sitting on top of the coffee. I was very charmed. Hope to see good things from this place! :)
author: Ruwen L.

description: Love this place. Great study spot with strong wifi, delicious coffee and snacks, and a cute corgi!  The workers are also really friendly!
author: Priscilla Y.

description: I come here randomly because it's right where I can transfer from the 5 to the 44. It has a nice atmosphere and a lot of people are relaxing on computers and reading. The menu has a lot of unique flavors. The coffee is alright but it's always barely warm when I receive it and the strawberry banana muffin was exciting but ended up being chewy and not too flavorful. They're never very crowded when I come in but I always end up standing around waiting for someone to notice I'm there/to answer me. I've gone a few times for convenience but not much else.
author: Laticia L.

description: I love coming to Rise and Grind to either work, read, or grab coffee with a friend. The cafe has a modern industrial look to it and has a very comfortable atmosphere to it. The staff and owners, Vy and Vashelle, are beyond amazing and friendly people. They will go the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied and happy. Rise & Grind serves delicious coffee, pastries, and toast. My usual go to is the cold brew, avocado toast, and the beer & bacon muffin. I can't recommend this place enough!
author: Richard W.

description: Its right next to my house so its pretty convenient. Their coffee is okay and pastries.
author: Katrina C.

description: Great place to stop if you're in the neighborhood or the park. The owners are extremely friendly and the drinks are delicious.
author: AJ F.

description: This place is the best! The owners V and Vashelle are super nice and attentive.  The mint iced cold brew is my favorite.  Can't wait to try the peanut butter latte.  The pastries from Devil's Teeth are exquisite.  So happy they opened in my neighborhood and I look forward to going there all the time!
author: J T.

description: delicious coffee and food, friendly and speedy service, nice atmosphere, really great cafe.
author: Joseph B.

description: This is probably my favourite Mr. Espresso coffee beans ,and they know how to make a coffee designs . With a delicious WAFFLES !!!
author: Kieu I.

description: Soooo good.  I had the whopper late and it was out of this world.  Love the minimalist decor and relaxing atmosphere.  The menu is unique, playful, and simply delicious!
author: Liza L.

description: The Whopper Latte here started my Saturday off great! The Belgian waffle was fluffy and complemented it perfectly. Friendly staff, local art, handmade benches- all the elements of a great cafe! Will definitely by coming back to try their mint cold brew...
author: Megan W.
